About
About
Ashutosh Yadav is a certified full stack developer based in Haryana, India, currently working as an SDE 1 at @xto10x, where he contributes to the development of the innovative SaaS tool, PeopleCues. With a strong technical foundation, Ashutosh specializes in a diverse tech stack that includes Java with Spring Boot, Node.js, Express.js, SCSS, React.js, AWS and various database technologies such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, and MongoDB. His primary focus is on backend development using Java and Spring Boot, along with cloud solutions leveraging AWS and the Serverless framework.

In addition to his professional expertise, Ashutosh has a keen interest in video editing, chess, and cybersecurity, showcasing his multifaceted skills and passion for continuous learning.

Projects

X Clone
X Clone
Jan 2024 - Mar 2024
Jan 2024 - Mar 2024
Xclone is an full stack ecommerce website made with MERN stack some of the key features include:

Here are some of the key features :

𝟭) 𝗦𝗶𝗴𝗻𝗶𝗻/𝗦𝗶𝗴𝗻𝘂𝗽:

I implemented proper validation and authentication using Yup, Zod, and JWT. The main routes are protected.

𝟮)𝗧𝘄𝗲𝗲𝘁:

A user can tweet, and each tweet has four options: comments, likes, reposts, and posts.

•The posts section contains both quoted and simple tweets.

•The repost section contains only the reposted content.

•The likes section contains posts liked by the user.

•The comments section contains the tweet itself along with the user’s comments on the tweet.

𝟯)𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗳𝗶𝗹𝗲:

A user can update their profile, including their name, bio, password, profile image, and cover image. Users can also view their followers and who they are following.

𝟰)𝗙𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄/𝗨𝗻𝗳𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄:

Users have the ability to follow and unfollow each other.

𝟱)𝗦𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵 𝗙𝘂𝗻𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆:

I implemented a search functionality that works on the concept of debouncing. This allows users to search for each other, view profiles, and follow or unfollow each other.

𝟲) 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝘀𝘆𝗻𝗰𝗵𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻

Implemented a time display feature for all tweet posts. If a tweet was posted less than 60 seconds ago, it will display ‘Just now’. If the tweet was posted less than an hour ago, the time will be displayed in minutes (e.g., ‘1 min’, ‘12 min’). The same format applies to days and months.

𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗰𝗸 𝗢𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄:

𝗖𝗹𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁-𝗦𝗶𝗱𝗲:

React.js (frontend library)
Axios (for API calls)
Yup (for form validation)

𝗦𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲𝗿-𝗦𝗶𝗱𝗲:

Node.js and Express.js (server-side language)
MongoDB (database)
Cloudinary and Multer (for storing images)
JWT and Bcrypt (for authentication)
Zod (for validation)
HTML5, React.js and +4 skills
X Clone
X Clone
NextCart
NextCart
Dec 2023 - Jan 2024
Dec 2023 - Jan 2024
NextCart is an full stack ecommerce website made with MERN stack some of the key features include:

𝟭) 𝗔𝗱𝗺𝗶𝗻 𝗗𝗮𝘀𝗵𝗯𝗼𝗮𝗿𝗱:

Manage products (Add/Edit/Delete products)

Manage orders (Update delivery status)

Change profile details (Name, email, address, description, image, password)

𝟮) 𝗨𝘀𝗲𝗿 𝗣𝗮𝗻𝗲𝗹:

Add products to cart (Modify quantity or delete products from cart)

Place orders (View delivery status)

Change profile details (Name, email, address, description, image, password)

Delete account (Only user accounts can be deleted)

𝟯) 𝗦𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝘀:

Implemented search functionality with proper debouncing to avoid unnecessary requests.

𝟰) 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗿 𝗔𝘂𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻:

Only registered users can add products to the cart.

User IDs can be deleted, while admin IDs cannot.

Implemented protected routes; for instance, if a user attempts to access a profile page or any protected route through manual routing, they will be redirected to the login page.

𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗰𝗸 𝗢𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄:

𝗖𝗹𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗦𝗶𝗱𝗲:

1) React Js.

2) Context API (for state management)

3) Owl Carousel (for image carousels)

𝗦𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝗶𝗱𝗲:

1) Node.js & Express

2) MongoDB (as Database)

3) JWT (for authentication)

4) Cloudinary and Multer (for image storage)
